update.description:
Since the release of dart 6.7, which included a [refactor of the ConstraintSolver](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1099), our jenkins builds have shown two test failures of `INTEGRATION_kinematic_loop` for the dart test variant and compiler warnings complaining about use of deprecated syntax in DARTPhysics.cc.

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/385/testReport/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/385/warnings22Result/

I reported this in #2605 and my struggles with using their new API, and @jlee02 promptly identified an issue and submitted https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1260 to fix it. I've left the original code in place for dart 6.6 and earlier, and added two new ifdef blocks for dart 6.7 and the unreleased dart 6.8, which represents the contents of dart PR 1260.

I suppose we could skip the 6.8 ifdef, since the 6.7 one should still work, but I think the 6.8 version is a bit cleaner.

This should fix the test failures and compiler warnings. Thanks to @jlee02 for the prompt fixes and helpful suggestions!
update.title: Fix #2605: kinematic loops for DART 6.7 and later

pullrequest.title: Fix #2605: kinematic loops for DART 6.7 and later

content.raw:
Yeah, I guess @pchorak mentioned that in the description of pull request #2756 that dantzig fails for this world, but we never filed an issue about it. He did report a [dantzig solver issue upstream](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/issues/892) for a slightly different model, but that problem may be related to invalid contact point generation rather than the LCP solver.

I'll make an issue in our issue tracker for that, but it is not a new failure.
content.html:
Yeah, I guess @pchorak mentioned that in the description of pull request #2756 that dantzig fails for this world, but we never filed an issue about it. He did report a dantzig solver issue upstream for a slightly different model, but that problem may be related to invalid contact point generation rather than the LCP solver.

I'll make an issue in our issue tracker for that, but it is not a new failure.

pullrequest.title: Fix #2605: kinematic loops for DART 6.7 and later

content.raw:
Testing with `test/worlds/anchored_loop.world`, the `pgs` solver seems to work fine and produces behavior consistent with other physics engines. But the `dantzig` solver does not work well. Is that expected?

For comparison:

`pgs`

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3836860151-anchored_loop_pgs.jpg)
‌

`dantzig` 

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1824435754-anchored_loop_dantzig.jpg)
content.html:
Testing with test/worlds/anchored_loop.world, the pgs solver seems to work fine and produces behavior consistent with other physics engines. But the dantzig solver does not work well. Is that expected?

For comparison:

pgs

‌

dantzig
